ALBERT VALENCIA Data Analyst | San Francisco, CA

About Me Projects

My Expertise

Over the past three years, I’ve worked across a variety of industries — from technology to agriculture — which has helped me bring together technical skills and real-world business context in every project I take on. In addition to my work as a data analyst, I’ve also taken on responsibilities in project management, product ownership, and quality assurance, where these experiences have helped me better collaborate across different teams and approach challenges from multiple angles.

I’ve found that being adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity has often been one of my strengths. I enjoy breaking down complex ideas into practical solutions that actually get used. Whether it's tackling technical problems or understanding what a team really needs to move forward, I’m focused on finding that middle ground and working collaboratively to get to the answer.

Outside of work, I’ve been passionate about video games for over a decade. I volunteer as a playtester for different games and software (mostly for the fun of it), because I enjoy understanding how people interact with systems. This experience has deepened my interest in user behavior and how even small changes can completely reshape a product experience.

Analytics

Making sense of messy data by turning it into clear, useful insights with Python, SQL, and visual tools that help teams make better decisions.

Development

Turning data into working systems — ETL pipelines, automations, and ML models that help teams uncover patterns, make smarter decisions, and move faster.

Storytelling

From project chaos to clear stories with intutive dashboards and seamless workfiows that boost collaboration and keep teams in synic
